channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IL

item.title: Report E-2024020148
item.description:
Report E-2024020148

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-12T18:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-02
  • City: SPRINGFIELD
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 2, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN1263 was crushed in transit and released approximately two (2) ounces of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted site. ES personnel deployed granular absorbents to the paint-impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents and the damaged pail were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report I-2024020015
item.description:
Report I-2024020015

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-12T18:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-04
  • City: Posen
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: STG LOGISTICS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: According to the information obtained, the following occurred. While at truckstop, a leak was detected coming from trailer. Posen Fire Department was dispatched to assess. Area was isolated and Hazchem Environmental Corp was dispatched to perform the cleanup. Upon arrival on site, Hazchem applied absorbent material to the affected asphalt and inpsected the trailer. One 55-gallon drum was discovered at nose of trailer, which had been punctured by a sharp object in transit. Hazchem proceeded to offload the trailer, overpacked the damaged drum, and cleaned the trailer floor. All spent absorbents were recovered from trailer floor and affected asphalt, which were placed into two 55-gallon drums. Product was contained to an impervious surface and did not threaten to impact surface soils or state waters. Two 55-gallon drums of spent absorbents and cleanup debris, and one overpack drum, were generated during cleanup, which were transported off site pending disposal. There were no injuries or exposures reported. ,
